item.text: I am telling the truth in Christ (I am not lying!), for my conscience assures me in the Holy Spirit—

<st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">have</st> <st data-num="3173" class="">great</st> <st data-num="3077" class="">sorrow</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="88" class="">unceasing</st> <st data-num="3601" class="">anguish</st> in <st data-num="1473" class="">my</st> <st data-num="2588" class="">heart</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> I could <st data-num="2172" class="">wish</st><n id="1" /> that <st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> <st data-num="846">myself</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">were</st> <st data-num="331" class="">accursed</st>—cut off <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> <st data-num="5547">Christ</st>—for the <st data-num="5228">sake</st> of <st data-num="1473" class="">my</st> <st data-num="80" class="">people</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="1473" class="">my</st> <st data-num="2596 4561">fellow</st> <st data-num="4773">countrymen</st>,<n id="3" />

<st data-num="3748" class="">who</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">are</st> <st data-num="2475" class="">Israelites</st>. To <st data-num="3739" class="">them</st> belong<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="5206">adoption as sons</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="1391" class="">glory</st>, the <st data-num="1242" class="">covenants</st>, the <st data-num="3548">giving of the law</st>, the <st data-num="2999">temple worship</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="1860" class="">promises</st>.
To them belong the patriarchs, and from them, by human descent, came the Christ, who is God over all, blessed forever! Amen.
It is not as though the word of God had failed. For not all those who are descended from Israel are truly Israel,
nor are all the children Abraham’s true descendants; rather “through Isaac will your descendants be counted.”

<st data-num="3778" class="">This</st> means<n id="1" /> it <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> the <st data-num="5043" class="">children</st> of the <st data-num="4561" class="">flesh</st><n id="2" /> who are the <st data-num="5043" class="">children</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God;</st> <st data-num="235" class="">rather</st>, the <st data-num="5043" class="">children</st> of <st data-num="1860" class="">promise</st> are <st data-num="3049" class="">counted</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">as</st> <st data-num="4690" class="">descendants</st>.
For this is what the promise declared: “About a year from now I will return and Sarah will have a son.”

<st data-num="3756" class="">Not</st> <st data-num="3441">only</st> that, <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> when <st data-num="4479" class="">Rebekah</st> <st data-num="2192" class="">had</st> <st data-num="2845" class="">conceived</st> children <st data-num="1537" class="">by</st> <st data-num="1520">one man</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="1473" class="">our</st> <st data-num="3962" class="">ancestor</st> <st data-num="2464" class="">Isaac</st>—

<st data-num="1063">even</st> <st data-num="3380" class="">before</st> they were <st data-num="1080" class="">born</st> <st data-num="3366">or</st> had <st data-num="4238" class="">done</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">anything</st> <st data-num="18" class="">good</st> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> <st data-num="5337" class="">bad</st> (<st data-num="2443">so that</st> <st data-num="2316">God’s</st> <st data-num="4286" class="">purpose</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">in</st> <st data-num="1589" class="">election</st><n id="1" /> would <st data-num="3306" class="">stand</st>, <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">by</st> <st data-num="2041" class="">works</st> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">by</st><n id="2" /> his <st data-num="2564">calling</st>)<n id="3" />—
it was said to her, “The older will serve the younger,”
just as it is written: “Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.”
What shall we say then? Is there injustice with God? Absolutely not!
For he says to Moses: “I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.”

<st data-num="686" class="">So</st> <st data-num="3767" class="">then</st>,<n id="1" /> it does <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> depend on <st data-num="2309">human desire</st> <st data-num="3761" class="">or</st> <st data-num="5143" class="">exertion</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> on <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> who <st data-num="1653">shows mercy</st>.
For the scripture says to Pharaoh: “For this very purpose I have raised you up, that I may demonstrate my power in you, and that my name may be proclaimed in all the earth.”
So then, God has mercy on whom he chooses to have mercy, and he hardens whom he chooses to harden.
You will say to me then, “Why does he still find fault? For who has ever resisted his will?”
But who indeed are you—a mere human being—to talk back to God? Does what is molded say to the molder, “Why have you made me like this?”

<st data-num="2192">Has</st> the <st data-num="2763" class="">potter</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">no</st> <st data-num="1849" class="">right</st> to <st data-num="4160" class="">make</st> <st data-num="1537">from</st> the <st data-num="846" class="">same</st> <st data-num="5445" class="">lump</st> of <st data-num="4081" class="">clay</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="3739">one</st> <st data-num="4632" class="">vessel</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">for</st> <st data-num="5092">special use</st> <st data-num="1161" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3739">another</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">for</st> <st data-num="819">ordinary use</st>?<n id="2" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> what <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>, <st data-num="2309" class="">willing</st> to <st data-num="1731" class="">demonstrate</st> his <st data-num="3709" class="">wrath</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> to <st data-num="1107">make known</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="1415" class="">power</st>, has <st data-num="5342" class="">endured</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">with</st> <st data-num="4183" class="">much</st> <st data-num="3115" class="">patience</st> the <st data-num="4632" class="">objects</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="3709" class="">wrath</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2675" class="">prepared</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">for</st> <st data-num="684" class="">destruction</st>?<n id="3" />

<st data-num="2532">And</st> what if he is willing <st data-num="2443">to</st> <st data-num="1107">make known</st> the <st data-num="4149" class="">wealth</st> of <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="1391" class="">glory</st> <st data-num="1909" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="4632" class="">objects</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="1656" class="">mercy</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">that</st> he has <st data-num="4282">prepared beforehand</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">for</st> <st data-num="1391" class="">glory</st>—

<st data-num="2532" class="">even</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">us</st>, <st data-num="3739" class="">whom</st> he has <st data-num="2564" class="">called</st>, <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="3441">only</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="1484" class="">Gentiles</st>?

As he also says in Hosea:

“I will call those who were not my people, ‘My people,’ and I will call her who was unloved, ‘My beloved.’”

“And in the very place where it was said to them, ‘You are not my people,’

there they will be called ‘sons of the living God.’”
And Isaiah cries out on behalf of Israel, “Though the number of the children of Israel are as the sand of the sea, only the remnant will be saved,
for the Lord will execute his sentence on the earth completely and quickly.”

Just as Isaiah predicted,

“If the Lord of Heaven’s Armies had not left us descendants,

we would have become like Sodom,

and we would have resembled Gomorrah.”
What shall we say then?—that the Gentiles who did not pursue righteousness obtained it, that is, a righteousness that is by faith,

<st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> <st data-num="2474" class="">Israel</st> even though <st data-num="1377" class="">pursuing</st><n id="1" /> a <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st> of <st data-num="1343" class="">righteousness</st><n id="2" /> did <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="5348" class="">attain</st> <st data-num="3551" class="">it</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="1223 5101">Why</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st>? <st data-num="3754" class="">Because</st> they pursued<n id="1" /> it <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">by</st> <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> (<st data-num="5613">as</st> if it were possible) <st data-num="1537" class="">by</st> <st data-num="2041" class="">works</st>.<n id="2" /> They <st data-num="4350">stumbled over</st> the <st data-num="4348" class="">stumbling</st> <st data-num="3037" class="">stone</st>,<n id="3" />

just as it is written,

“Look, I am laying in Zion a stone that will cause people to stumble

and a rock that will make them fall,

yet the one who believes in him will not be put to shame.”
